title: Apply Even-Odd Identities
text: Recall the following properties: tangent is odd, cosine is even, and sine is odd.

title: Rewrite Each Term
text: Apply the identities to each part of the expression: $$cos\left(-x\right)+\operatorname{tannegneg}\left(x\right) \operatorname{sinnegneg}\left(x\right)$$ $$=cos\left(x\right)+\left(-tan\left(x\right)\right) \left(-sin\left(x\right)\right)$$ $$=cos\left(x\right)+tan\left(x\right) sin\left(x\right)$$

title: Express cotx in Terms of sinx and cosx
text: Recall that $$tan(x)=\frac{sinx}{cosx}$$. Substitute this in: $$=cos\left(x\right)+\frac{sinx}{cosx} sin\left(x\right)$$ $$=\frac{{cos}^2 x+{sin}^2 x}cos^$\left(x\righ$$ $$=\frac{1}cos^$\left(x\righ$$ $$=sec(x)$$
